intro: Mandevilla donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Donnell-Smith mandevilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its vigorous growth and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of bright pink or red blooms during the summer months. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and is often cultivated as a ornamental plant. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth, glossy surface.
